body_html:
Hey @AnkitaKhurana ✌️

Thanx for reporting 🙏

The question here is: how could this be "fixed"? The column is based on the timezone attribute of a user record which is right now non-mandatory. See the user form for this 👇

I'm personally strongly against making more attributes of the user profile mandatory unless they really have a benefit in making the program easier to run / easier for the orga team or something similar. Otherwise, it just raises the bar for new users creating their accounts, e.g. potential coaches, which would be sad if we'd miss them.

Right now, the country is a mandatory attribute. Guessing a user's timezone based on her country won't work though. Plus: eventually people want to change their timezone when they're travelling.. 🤔

I would be inclined to close this issue as something we cannot "fix" (or maybe don't need to fix 😉 ). Or what would be your take on this? Did you already have an idea in mind how to solve this?

body:
Hey @AnkitaKhurana ✌️ 

Thanx for reporting 🙏 

The question here is: how could this be "fixed"? The column is based on the `timezone` attribute of a user record which is right now non-mandatory. See the user form for this 👇 
![artboard 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3491815/36644195-00d78146-1a57-11e8-9c41-cc4a17e02c3d.png)

I'm personally strongly against making more attributes of the user profile *mandatory* unless they **really** have a benefit in making the program easier to run / easier for the orga team or something similar. Otherwise, it just raises the bar for new users creating their accounts, e.g. potential coaches, which would be sad if we'd miss them.

Right now, the `country` is a mandatory attribute. Guessing a user's timezone based on her country won't work though. Plus: eventually people want to change their timezone when they're travelling.. 🤔 

I would be inclined to close this issue as something we cannot "fix" (or maybe don't need to fix 😉 ). Or what would be your take on this? Did you already have an idea in mind how to solve this?
